Macron's slow shift toward recognizing the State of Palestine
subhead: After expressing unwavering support for Israel, the French president gradually shifted his stance on the two-state solution following October 7, 2023, and the conflict in Gaza. This reversal will culminate in France's official recognition of the State of Palestine at the UN on September 22.

Estonia says UN Security Council to meet over Russian air incursion
subhead: 'On September 22... the United Nations Security Council will convene an emergency meeting in response to Russia's brazen violation of Estonian airspace last Friday,' a statement from the Estonian ministry said.

title: Bernard Arnault riles French left with attack on economist behind wealth tax plan
subhead: France's richest man described Gabriel Zucman, the academic behind a plan to have the ultra-rich pay at least a 2% tax on their fortune, as a 'far-left activist' who wanted to 'destroy the French economy.'

title: China's Covid-era witness Zhang Zhan reportedly sentenced to jail in new case
subhead: Lawyer Zhang Zhan, disbarred for her human rights activism, was arrested again in August 2024, just a few months after finishing her first four-year prison sentence following the Wuhan lockdown.

title: Giverny's thriving business around Monet's gardens risks oversaturation
subhead: Chinese and American film shoots and a prime minister who has made it his home base: Just an hour from Paris, this village of 460 residents draws hundreds of thousands of visitors. Yet its fame brings little benefit to the locals.

France's situation causes concern in Brussels
subhead: The country's political instability, the rise of the far right and deteriorating public finances are worrying its European partners. The appointment of PM Sébastien Lecornu, who has so far not been very involved in EU affairs, has done little to reassure them.

title: French protestors caught between anger and disillusionment
subhead: Eight days after the 'Block Everything' protest movement on September 10, the union coalition called for mobilization against 'austerity' on Thursday, September 18. More than 250 gatherings took place across France, demanding a change in political direction and greater tax justice.

title: Two French baby boomers on what their generation got wrong
subhead: The economist Jean Pisani-Ferry and the politician Jean-Louis Bourlanges each delivered a harsh review of the past decades as they were decorated with the Légion d'Honneur in early September.
